channel.title: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i60.tinypic.com/15d506h.png[/img][/center]
[hr] [i][b]Notes:[/b][/i] - The project will be hoested in a pre-alpha stage once we feel contempt with the server - If you have any feedback/suggestions feel free to post.
[hr] The development team consists of three developers and a community management team which will manage the community when the server is release for public use.
[i][b]Development -[/b][/i] [i] [ul][li]- SJ[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]- Daginith[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]- [/li][/ul]
[b]Client developer -[/b]
[ul][li]- [/li][/ul]
[i][b]Community Management -[/b][/i]
[ul][li]-[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]-[/li][/ul]
[hr] [i][b]Introduction:[/b][/i] Ysvalon is simply a unique server, the server will consist of many new and unique events, cycles, and most likely unseen content in a private server. Ysvalon will have no weapons or armor above runite, magika will also be an integral part of the server however it's not going to be 'you're in the jungle, a bear attack you bind it and run away' Ysvalon will utilize a survival spell book for instance, Ysvalon will have a system during the night cycle the 'temperature' will drop, if you're walking/running through the world to another city, during that time you are prone to hypothermia the spellbook will contain an 'ignite fire' spell, if you have a log/plank in your inventory you will be able to light a fire without a formal tinderbox. Anyway, no more spoiling! ;) [hr] [i][b]Headway for Development:[/b][/i] Uncomplete - Red In progress - Orange Complete - Green
[b]Content:[/b] [size=8pt]Survival magika spells[/size] [size=8pt]Enlist/delist option to join a factions army under oath to the current King/ruler[/size] [size=8pt]Factions system[/size] [size=8pt]Day/night cycle system - Need to tweak cycle times, currently it changes every 60 seconds[/size] [size=8pt]Bonfires[/size] [size=8pt]King/Queen/Ruler system[/size] [size=8pt]Armory/war system[/size] [size=8pt]Add music/sound system[/size] [s][size=8pt]Python scripting system[/size][/s]
[b]Skills:[/b] Uncomplete - Red In progress - Orange Complete - Green
[s][size=8pt]Prayer[/size][/s] [s][size=8pt]Fishing[/size][/s] [s][size=8pt]Firemaking[/size][/s] [s][size=8pt]Fletching[/size][/s] [s][size=8pt]Crafting[/size][/s] [hr] [b]Media:[/b] None at the moment [hr]
[code] Updates: 02/03/14 - Based the system off blakeman's old one. Kept core components and redid everything to dfit this server. Everything now saves and reads .dat files 02/03/14 - Fixed a few bugs related to the new system player saving system. (i.e.) wasn't returning a value when the password is wrong, causing the server to allow any password. And a few other things. Seems to be working fine now. 02/03/14 - Cleaned up some useless code, doc'd code 02/02/14 - changed a few things in RS2LoginProtocalDecoder to allow for the new login system. 03/02/14 - Redid the player save system, now in binary. (*.dat) 03/02/14 - Fixed login issues with new player saving system. 03/02/14 - Several changes in RS2LoginProtocolDecoder class to allow for the new player saving system 03/02/14 - Made it so you can't have a blank password/username, or a taken username. 03/02/12 - Fixed some client return messages. 03/02/14 - Wrote an XStream parser for npc spawning/npc drops 03/02/14 - Wrote a new commands class - can't handled shit crammed into a single class 04/02/14 - wrote jdbc connector 04/02/14 - fixed a deadlock in the playersaving class 05/02/14 - Added day/night cycling - need to tweak code, cycles are updated via time passed as a parameter 05/02/14 - Finished python scripting system[/code]
Want to apply? One more developer spot is open. Name: Previous experiences (use pastebin and post on the topic): Position: More will be added to the thread at a later time

item.title: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

It’s a cool idea in theory, but in reality the demand just isn’t there and nobody will play. You’re just taking a really crappy game and making it into something it wasn’t designed for. I don’t know if you saw the DayZ version of an RSPS that was put online a few months back but they aimed for more realism (kind of like you guys with temperature and stuff) and it really doesn’t work at all simply because of how the user interfaces with the game and how rs works (region loading, the chat function etc). That being said you could rework a lot of the functionality to account for new implementations of what RS is, but really, you’re just using the wrong base to do a adaptation like this on.

Regardless, good luck and it should be interesting to see where this ends up.

Read full topic
item.source: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect

item.title: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[size=4]02/05/14 - UPDATES![/size]

-Wrote a Day/Night Handler. There are now daytimes and nighttimes in game!
-Day/Night is system wide, and based on server-time. (i.e. will be the same for everyone).
-Wrote a method to handle Brightness (Server sided, sucks right now to be honest. Need to make it darker client sided)

[size=4]EX.[/size]

I understand the brightness system is imperfect at this time. The main point in changing the brightness at this stage is to show how my Time Cycle system is implemented.

I’m still figuring out a way to make it seem more like ‘nighttime’. Maybe ill add creepers. (;

If anyone has suggestions, I’d be glad to hear them! (:

Read full topic

As for some questions to help others out when they do decide to join.

What base are you using?
Is Python the only scripting language you’re willing to use?
Again, what positions are you currently looking to fill?[/quote]

Nope, we can use which ever language most of us know, and that’s python. You obviously took no time to read the topic, it’s right at the top.

update: 04/02/13 - fixed a deadlock in the player saving class

item.title: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:6, topic:539454”]i feel as tho magic will ruin this concept.

why sit in the middle of a jungle at night when you can teleport away?
you see a monster coming at you, just bind it and run?

i think if you’re going to incorporate magic, you should build your own spell book with only survival type spells, perhaps like a lunar v2

when you’re in the ‘wild’ some plants should have ‘wild’ berries/leaves. these should be edible.
some may harm you, some may make you sick, and some may poison you.

this will build a necessity for medicine. you must gather plants, or seeds to grow these plants, to make the medicine. each faction can have a specific medicinal plant to their land, thus requiring other factions to sneak in and pick seeds or plants to benefit their own faction.

plants should be able to be grown in pots in the inventory, as well as patches. this allows the user to grow medicine and/or food whilst out adventuring.

there should be a spell for harvesting the plants to reduce the amount of time taken, perhaps with a high rune amount, so it will usually only be used for the richest of players, or in dire emergencies to get the medicine.

there will be chills at night time, and if you’ve forgotten the fire gear, you should be able to harvest some dry sticks/wood from fallen logs/dead trees around the game.
you should also be granted the spell to ignite a fire.
perhaps even a ‘generate warmth’ spell for use in areas where wood cannot be obtained, but you must get warm before freezing.

spells needed to cook food will be a benefit to allow more inventory space to cook food on journeys.

spells for curing yourself of poison should be possible, but with high rune intake.

there may be the option to ‘fulfill hunger’, which is only temporary, decreasing the interval of your next hunger. (sort of like eating food with low saturation on minecraft. the spell will make it fill you up, but it will take less time to grow hungry again. constantly using the spell will result in, ‘you are no longer hungry for magic’ or some shit. and you must start eating real food (at the hunger intervals) to grow the hunger timer back to normal.)

hunting (if incorporated) should be more like real life, rather than runescape’s.
all npcs should be able to be hunted. the player must sneak up on the animal (be x amount of tiles away, and the npc must not be facing the player. if the npc turns around, it will automatically spot the player and run.) perhaps adding a ‘wind direction’ variable for the smells, and maybe a tool to tell you which way the wind is. then the player must be equipping a bow, and the option to ‘shoot’ or ‘hunt’ animal should be available.

depending on the target, range level, and arrows used, the players will either kill the beast (will get meat, your own arrows, and perhaps the arrowheads of other hunters(random)), miss and scare it off, hit the target and lose the arrow (beast got away because not skilled enough)
this only applies to non-combatable npcs, if they can fight back, they will attack after being shot at.

if you want more ideas, give me feedback and also which skill/concept you want ideas for.[/quote]

Yeah, I was thinking of incorporating magic. Thanks for the input pal if you want to share more ideas feel free to inbox them.

Read full topic
item.source: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect

item.title: Ysvalon - Simply unique, in every aspect
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i feel as tho magic will ruin this concept.

why sit in the middle of a jungle at night when you can teleport away?
you see a monster coming at you, just bind it and run?

i think if you’re going to incorporate magic, you should build your own spell book with only survival type spells, perhaps like a lunar v2

when you’re in the ‘wild’ some plants should have ‘wild’ berries/leaves. these should be edible.
some may harm you, some may make you sick, and some may poison you.

this will build a necessity for medicine. you must gather plants, or seeds to grow these plants, to make the medicine. each faction can have a specific medicinal plant to their land, thus requiring other factions to sneak in and pick seeds or plants to benefit their own faction.

plants should be able to be grown in pots in the inventory, as well as patches. this allows the user to grow medicine and/or food whilst out adventuring.

there should be a spell for harvesting the plants to reduce the amount of time taken, perhaps with a high rune amount, so it will usually only be used for the richest of players, or in dire emergencies to get the medicine.

there will be chills at night time, and if you’ve forgotten the fire gear, you should be able to harvest some dry sticks/wood from fallen logs/dead trees around the game.
you should also be granted the spell to ignite a fire.
perhaps even a ‘generate warmth’ spell for use in areas where wood cannot be obtained, but you must get warm before freezing.

spells needed to cook food will be a benefit to allow more inventory space to cook food on journeys.

spells for curing yourself of poison should be possible, but with high rune intake.

there may be the option to ‘fulfill hunger’, which is only temporary, decreasing the interval of your next hunger. (sort of like eating food with low saturation on minecraft. the spell will make it fill you up, but it will take less time to grow hungry again. constantly using the spell will result in, ‘you are no longer hungry for magic’ or some shit. and you must start eating real food (at the hunger intervals) to grow the hunger timer back to normal.)

hunting (if incorporated) should be more like real life, rather than runescape’s.
all npcs should be able to be hunted. the player must sneak up on the animal (be x amount of tiles away, and the npc must not be facing the player. if the npc turns around, it will automatically spot the player and run.) perhaps adding a ‘wind direction’ variable for the smells, and maybe a tool to tell you which way the wind is. then the player must be equipping a bow, and the option to ‘shoot’ or ‘hunt’ animal should be available.

depending on the target, range level, and arrows used, the players will either kill the beast (will get meat, your own arrows, and perhaps the arrowheads of other hunters(random)), miss and scare it off, hit the target and lose the arrow (beast got away because not skilled enough)
this only applies to non-combatable npcs, if they can fight back, they will attack after being shot at.

if you want more ideas, give me feedback and also which skill/concept you want ideas for.

Read full topic
